catalog_info.title: Childhood in African America
catalog_info.description: A seminar on children and childhood in African American history and cultures from 1773 through the present. Authors may include Phillis Wheatley, Frederick Douglass, W. E. B. Du Bois, Langston Hughes, Toni Morrison, and Suzan-Lori Parks; topics may include slavery, abolition, literacy, popular performance, film and television, Civil Rights, celebrity, the Moynihan Report, systemic violence (including poverty), education, and the American Girl Dolls.
